topics.body:
So apparently the "data" on how steam refunds was "hurting" indie developers was fabricated; the so called "data" was showing sales data during a steam sale vs post steam sale.  If anything it showed that the steam refund policy was statistically insignificant and that there was not enough data to justify anything.

Tl:dr; there is no actual data to prove that steam refunds are hurting games and what data there is statistically insignificant.

topics.body:
Oh yeah, insidious 3 was good. It did some interesting stuff. For example: 
[spoiler]a possessed girl with broken legs breaking her casts off and ominously walking towards you with a box cutter and her legs cracking with every step[/spoiler]

And some dumb stuff. For example: 
[spoiler]an old lady flinging another old lady(that's a ghost) across the room and saying "come on, bitch"[/spoiler]

^i honestly kinda like it when horror movies do dumb shit like that^

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557749196368726ae3000c61#post_557749196368726ae3000c61
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557749f66368722c1300137c#post_557749f66368722c1300137c
I'd say '06 and Boom were equally terrible games, but it really depends on what you find from each game to be worse.

'06 is broken as all hell and the narrative is absolutely dumb.

Boom was just bland, boring, and uninteresting overall.

Whichever one you find to be the bigger problem will determine which game you find to be worse. Like I said before, I can't decide personally. I'd argue that '06 reaches lower levels of crap IMO, but is pulled back up a bit by its good soundtrack. Boom offends me a bit less, but doesn't have much good to fall back on, the quality soundtrack that helps '06 barely survive is nonexistant in Boom.
topics.author: 9ba2e84e636164642cc03200
